wikipedia_page.main: Frank Wynyard Wright (6 April 1844 – 15 February 1924) played first-class cricket for Oxford University and Lancashire, plus other amateur sides, as a middle-order batsman and occasional wicketkeeper in the 1860s. He was born at Woodstock, Oxfordshire, England and died at Eastbourne, Sussex, England. He was the cousin of the England Test cricketer and FA Cup-winning footballer Teddy Wynyard. He was educated at St John's College, Oxford, then became a Church of England priest and was rector of Hedsor, Buckinghamshire, 1870–76.

response: Frank Wright, sometimes but not always an abbreviation of Francis Wright, may refer to:
* Frank Wright (jazz musician) (1935–1990), free jazz saxophonist
* Frank Wright Jr. (1912–2008), American commercial artist
* Frank Wright (sport shooter) (1878–1931), American sport shooter
* Frank Wright, co-founder of A&W Restaurants
